article:
{{Diagnostic infobox | Name = | Image = | Caption = | ICD10 = | ICD9 = -, |
MeshID = | OPS301 = | OtherCodes = | }} A 'Meningeal biopsy' is a biopsy
performed of the meninges of the central nervous system.

It can involve the coverings of the brain or of the spinal cord.

MRI or CT may be used prior to the biopsy to assist in identifying the location
for the biopsy.
